result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mariscla Zavala-Garcia

records.addlTxt:
2:33 PM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mariscla Zavala-Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Mariscla Zavala-Garcia. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Shamali advises the Court that he received an offer and is requesting an adjournment to continue to work towards resolution with the State. Court adjourns.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:20 AM Attorney Daniel Joseph Tombasco in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Mariscla Zavala-Garcia in court, in custody.  Attorney Chad A Shamali in court for Mariscla Zavala-Garcia. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Bond motion filed by Attorney Shamali. Arguments heard; the State objects to any bond modification. Court denies the bond motion for reasons set forth on the record. Court leaves matter on for next scheduled court activity.

09:14  AM   Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Defendant, Mariscla Zavala-Garcia, appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.   Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Attorney Shamali is requesting additional time to discuss resolution with the State. Attorney Shamali also states he filed a bond motion yesterday. State is not waiving their 5 day notice and requests a bail/bond hearing. Court will not hear bond motion at this time. Court adjourns.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 23, 2022 at 11:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Marisela Zavala-Garcia appeared with Attorney Chad A Shamali.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for September 2, 2022 at 09:00 am.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.
  *No Weapons especially firearms.   *Not To Possess or Consume Controlled Substances w/o a Prescription.  No drug paraphenalia.   No contact including the residence, electronic or 3rd party with: Red Oaks Motel - Kenosha.   The DE may make arrangements with a party or law enforcement to retrieve personal property and/or medication from the victim's Red Oaks Motel residence within 24 hours of signing the bond in this case.  The DE may not be the party retrieving any property and/or medication.

02:29 PM  Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Francesco Balistrieri.   Clerk JT  Minutes:  Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days;   Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 10:00 am.. $5000  Cash Bond Set w/conditions (see bond entry). DE name amended to Marisela, error in complaint. rbn
and witness list filed by the State
